Day 1.title: Exercise on Comments #1
Day 1.description: Add comments to explain what a variable does in your program.
Day 1.sample_solution:
x = 10  # This variable stores the user age
print(x)

Day 1.title: Exercise on Comments #2
Day 1.description: Write a program with inline comments explaining each step.
Day 1.sample_solution:
# This program adds two numbers
a = 5
b = 10
print(a + b)

Day 1.title: Exercise on Syntax basics #3
Day 1.description: Write a Python program that prints your name, age, and favorite language.

Day 1.title: Exercise on Syntax basics #4
Day 1.description: Write a program that prints 'Hello, Python!' three times.

Day 1.title: Exercise on Syntax basics #5
Day 1.description: Write a script that prints the result of 3 + 5.

Day 1.title: Exercise on Comments #6
Day 1.description: Add a comment at the top of your code with your name and date.
Day 1.sample_solution:
# Author: You | Date: Today
print('Starting program')

Day 1.title: Exercise on Print function #7
Day 1.description: Print a triangle pattern using the `print()` function.
Day 1.sample_solution: for i in range(1, 6): print('*' * i)

Day 1.title: Exercise on Print function #8
Day 1.description: Print a formatted receipt using tabs and newlines.

Day 1.title: Exercise on Comments #9
Day 1.description: Write a script that includes a multiline comment describing the script.
Day 1.sample_solution:
"""
This script calculates the square of a number
"""
x = 4
print(x**2)

Day 1.title: Exercise on Print function #10
Day 1.sample_solution: for i in range(1, 11): print(f'5 x {i} = {5*i}')

Day 1.title: Exercise on Comments #11
Day 1.description: Create a Python script with useless code and comment it out.
Day 1.sample_solution:
# print('This line is commented out')
print('This line runs')

Day 1.title: Exercise on Syntax basics #12
Day 1.description: Write a Python script to swap two variables.
Day 1.sample_solution:
a, b = 5, 10
a, b = b, a
print(a, b)
